sources.title: The Cardinal's Conspiracy (1909) starring Florence Lawrence
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     "The Cardinal's Conspiracy" is a short drama, included in our program to illustrate the work of Florence Lawrence and Billy Bitzer, stars of Silent Hall of Fame. When a royal beauty rejects her preordained husband, a cardinal conspires to make her change her mind. Directed by                       D.W. Griffith Cinematography by         G.W. Bitzer Starring                             Florence Lawrence, Frank  Powell, James Kirkwood Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                      July 12, 1909 Country                             United States Language                           Silent, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: A royal woman rejects her arranged marriage. The cardinal hatches a plan: the suitor will shave and change clothes. He arranges with 4 clowns to stage an attack on the princess which he easily repels. It works; the princess falls for him, especially when the cardinal arranges his arrest.
metadata.Actors: James Kirkwood, Florence Lawrence, Frank Powell
